EmailTemplate.subject: Safely Add Hyper-V Diversity Into Your Environment
EmailTemplate.textOnly: <[[http://vmturbo.com/blog/safely-add-hyper-v-diversity-to-your-it-environment?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ENG-Mult-Hypv&utm_content=Early02]]> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=There}}, In the natural world, the healthiest ecosystems are those that are the most diverse. Things aren’t so different in your company’s IT ecosystem; however, the process of increasing diversity can often come with increased risk. VMware's hypervisor is the bread and butter of most virtualized environments and can be found in practically every datacenter. Recently however, Microsoft's Hyper-V has developed some additional technical maturity and enterprises are taking notice. Hyper-V may look like a good option for many, but enterprises have a lot to consider before they begin to create more diverse environments. The key to successfully introducing diversity is a process, click below to learn about successfully introducing Hyper-V, as well as other hypervisors, into your environment. <[[http://vmturbo.com/blog/safely-add-hyper-v-diversity-to-your-it-environment?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ENG-Mult-Hypv&utm_content=Early02]]> - The VMTurbo Team
